segments.text: I see the woman standing in that puddle like it’s nothing, and it’s making me frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and I can’t believe she hasn’t caught them yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like he’s a circus performer, and it’s terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie like it’s the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to regret not paying attention when she finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just flowing and flowing, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children even realize how much trouble they could be in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, but inside, everything is going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the stool doesn’t tip over and hurt the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a silent comedy of errors, but no one is laughing.
segments.speaker: PAR
